events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle on the highway.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident following the initial report.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the case and contact the customer for further details.
The customer was notified that their claim has been received and is being processed.
The claims agent requested photos of the car damage and a police report to proceed.
The customer submitted all requested documentation including the police report and car repair estimates.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacted witnesses.
The investigation concluded the insured was not at fault and damage estimates were verified.
A settlement amount covering all repair costs was proposed to the insured for approval.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt service.
The claim was officially approved following the customer’s acceptance of the settlement terms.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the insured’s account.
The claim file was closed after successful settlement and payment issuance without any further issues.
The claim documentation and records were archived in compliance with company policy and regulatory requirements.
